IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: This is the planned power cut that was previously scheduled for last year but was cancelled on the day due to access issues. To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a piece of equipment called a transformer that needs replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. We will remove the existing transformer and install a new one on the same day. During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we carry out this essential. To connect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. This work is taking place near Rabans Lane.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 14:08 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to safely repair an underground fault in the Harrowes Meade HA8 8 area.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 12:48 - Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers. We know your power may now be back on, however; we'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 10:58 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Harrowes Meade HA8 8 area for safety so they can repair a fault on the underground network. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Bev at 05:16 - Thanks for your patience today, we're happy to say our staff have now restored power to all but one property in the Royal Oak Drive area. I'm sorry for any disruption we caused by having to turn off your power to repair an unexpected underground cable fault.

We'd still like to keep you informed if your electricity hasn't been restored. Please call us free any time on 08003163105 if we haven't already reached out to you by phone or in person at your property.

We apologise for the outage and understand that being without power can be challenging. Rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep your lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 04:23 - Thanks for your patience over tonight.

Our engineers have let us know that the repairs to the underground cable fault are more complex than previously anticipated. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 04:30 and 05:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 10:16 - We can now confirm that all power in the Jacklin Green area should be back on.

To fix the issue permanently we're trying to find the underlying root cause, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 10:10 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Jacklin Green area, the estimated time of 13:00-14:00 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Talie at 09:56.

Sent by Simon at 14:05 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers investigated the cause of the power cut in the Vale Road area. We can now confirm that the issue is a fault on our underground electricity cabling and there are 3 properties affected, which we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Will at 13:05 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers. Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair. We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site, and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.

Sent by Simon at 15:35 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 2141 customers in the Lewes, BN8 5 area by diverting power around an underground cable fault. We're pleased that we have been able to restore power sooner than we estimated.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

For more information just click here: https://UKPN.short.gy/PSR If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 15:29 - We can now confirm that all power in the Hanbury Street area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Hanbury Street area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Kevin at 15:01.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 14:42 - Our staff are on the way to the Hanbury Street area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 18:00 and 19:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Kevin at 15:01.

Sent by Kevin at 14:42 - Our staff are on the way to the Hanbury Street area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 18:00 and 19:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 20:29 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 18:59 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the Carlton Terrace area should now be back on.

Following thorough tests at our substation and on local network equipment, our staff have been able to safely replace our network equipment. The suspected underground cabling issue is not yet appearing on any of our tests, so for the moment we have restored your power as quickly as possible.

I'm afraid this may happen again, but every time you lose power it gives us a better chance of pinpointing the problem. I'm sorry for the continued disruption, but If you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this evening. We want to be as transparent as possible as we know having multiple power cuts is disruptive and worrying, so I would like to help explain why we can't always fix a problem like this right away.

Underground electricity cabling is insulated for safety and if a fault develops, these materials can re-seal due to heat passing through them when our safety equipment operates and your power is lost. This covers any potential fault again, meaning our staff cannot locate it using their tests or specialist equipment.

We'll know more once our staff contact us again, so I'll be in touch again shortly.

Sent by Simon at 18:48.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Carlton Terrace area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to be testing if the network is still healthy.

They will start at the substation, and often apply specialist equipment that may turn your power back on for a brief period, so don't worry if your power comes on and goes off again. They will also check smaller sites which run along our cabling route, these break our network down into smaller sections and can help pinpoint any possible problems.

Our estimated time frame of 23:00-00:00 hasn't changed, so I'll let you know more once our staff update us. Sent by Simon at 18:34.

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 19:17. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: An underground electricity cable has faulted on our high voltage network, causing an area wide power cut.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  We are arranging to have engineers investigate the fault.  We are sorry we can't give you a time for the restoration of supply at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 21:08 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Military Road area, the estimated time of 01:00-02:00 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Simon at 20:21.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 20:12 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Military Road area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 01:00 and 02:00, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Aaron at 21:10 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an overhead network fault that initially interrupted power to 1201 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 234 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 22:30-23:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We're investigating a high voltage overhead electricity line fault which has caused a power cut in the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Aaron at 21:10 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an overhead network fault that initially interrupted power to 1201 properties.

However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 234 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment.

We're currently estimating power will be on between 22:30-23:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find.

Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
